info.headline: TEST Tsunami Warning for Victoria
info.description: TEST Tsunami warning for Victoria. An undersea earthquake of magnitude 6.8 has occurred at 6:33 AM AWST on Monday 17 November 2014 centred OFF E. COAST OF N. ISLAND, N.Z.. A threat of major land inundation, dangerous waves and strong ocean currents exists for the following areas: - All low-lying coastal areas from Lakes Entrance to SA Border Dangerous inundation is expected in this zone after 4:00 pm (AWST) Monday The Land Inundation Threat Zone includes West Coast, Central Coast, Central Gippsland Coast, East Gippsland Coast, Port Phillip, Western Port and Gippsland Lakes. A threat of dangerous waves, strong ocean currents and the possibility of inundation of the immediate foreshore exists for the following areas: - All coastal areas from West Coast, Central Coast, Central Gippsland Coast, East Gippsland Coast, Port Phillip, Western Port and Gippsland Lakes after 4:00 pm (AWST) Monday Caution, the first wave may not necessarily be the largest wave and tsunami waves are more dangerous and powerful than normal beach waves.
info.instruction: Please go to www.bom.gov.au/tsunami for the more detailed tsunami bulletins containing advice of actions to take.

area.areaDesc: West Coast, Central Coast, Central Gippsland Coast, East Gippsland Coast, Port Phillip, Western Port, Gippsland Lakes
